title: Saira10
author: Saira10
content: Hi, I hope you are all doing well. I am a teacher and teach students about IT. But from my job, I cannot fulfil my expenses that why start learning about Bitcoin the last 3 months my friend told me about the Bitcointalk forum in start working on bounties but not earned any money yet Now he said to make post other section will help me to trade and earning. I read the rules before posting. Can someone guide me on how I manage my time and earn money from trading what is an effective way to start?

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 03:09:56 PM<snip>My first thought about this thread is that it's about bitcoin trading, like, the literal trading. But it seems like you meant about earning through bounties. But the last sentence made me confused again. Regardless, I assume you are referring to bounties. It is hard to earn through bounty hunting. There are very few promising campaigns but has bunch of bounty hunters. If you have any service that can offer here, you can try that. Like, if you are a designer, Social Media Manager, etc.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 03:09:56 PMBut from my job, I cannot fulfil my expenses that why start learning about Bitcoin the last 3 months Bitcoin does not provide an alternative source of income. If your job cannot meet your expenses, try to find another job which can be a side hustle that helps you sustain your financial needs.Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 03:09:56 PMmy friend told me about the Bitcointalk forum in start working on bounties but not earned any money yetYou would not earn anything cause you came in with the wrong mindset. This is a bitcoin forum to discuss about bitcoin and not to earn about bounties. Focus on the discussions and you would learn a lot more than you can on bounties.- Jay -

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Your questions are a bit confusing but I will take it this way First as an IT person there some certain skills you might have that could help you render services either on the forum or outside it, just explore the service board and see those on the forums. Secondly concerning bounties or airdrops, they are hardly beneficial anymore most except some few that come through and that would explain why you haven’t earn anything since you have been here. Also the trading part you mentioned is different from bounties. Trading do pay off but it requires you to have capital and essential knowledge of it. Also it has his risk that it is advisable to go into it with money you can afford to lose. The easiest way to earn on the forum currently is through signature campaigns. That too requires you to grow in ranks within the forum before you’re deemed eligible. You can only grow in the forum rank by contributing meaningful either through creating helpful contents or threads you have knowledge about or by sharing your knowledge when one needs help in the forum

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: You should probably stop listening to that your friend, firstly you don't just post anything on every section like he had told you, if you want to post about trading and check the forum on trading matter then there is a trading board for it.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=8.0Also your friend doesn't know how crypto-currency works and he is just probably throwing false information at you, first what's your mindset about? Set your target read through Bitcoin and Crypto-currency in general and understand what you actually can do, you won't be profitable in trading just because your friend asked you to or on the basis that you want to earn.

You can really disrupt your life if you focus too much.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 06:07:14 PM<...>Hey there! It's great to hear that you're exploring new avenues to supplement your income. Teaching IT and diving into the world of Bitcoin, that's quite the dynamic duo!But now I wonder, if you are really a teacher teaching students about IT, how come you haven't heard of Bitcoin before? I mean, it's not like Bitcoin is a secret or anything. It's been around since 2009 and has had quite the impact on the world we live in today. So how come you've never heard of it before?Regarding your question about how to manage your time and earn money from trading, there are no simple answers. Everyone's situation is different, which means that there really isn't a one-size-fits-all solution to this problem. I can tell you, however, that if you're serious about trading and want to make money doing it, then you need to be willing to put in the work. There's no such thing as getting rich quick with cryptocurrency, even if some people may try to convince you otherwise!

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 03:09:56 PM~snip~Since you have the mindset of earning through bounty based on who referred you to this place, that mindset might actually hinder you a little because your focus might all be on the bounty section. And you have to change that mindset. Follow up on a few trading tips through the link shared by Tabas; it will really help you gain a little knowledge about trading, and when you have learned a few things, you can give it a try and learn how to reduce losses. Please note that crypto currency trading doesn't always guarantee profit. You can also actually earn online. If I get you correctly, you said you teach children IT courses. Those skills you can perfect online. Advertise yourself either in this forum or outside of this place. There are a lot of freelancing sites where you can offer your skills, upload your portfolio, and clients will look at it and pay for your time. You can actually start making real money, which you could use to foot all your bills, adding to your little teaching earnings.

comments.author: BD Crypto
comments.body: At first my advice to you is that don't start trading before you have learnt a lot about crypto. Because there are chances that you may lose your funds if market crash on a bad news. You may learn more about trading from YouTube and be an expert. After that you can start your trading journey. Always try to manage a few time and watch the market situation and you can set take profit and stop loss and in this way you can manage your order by not giving too much time in trading.

You don't need to spend all your time in the forum. Your spare time will be enough. Just avoid other time-wasting activities like using social media just for fun.

comments.author: Rengga Jati
comments.body: Quote from: Saira10 on May 26, 2023, 03:09:56 PMHi, I hope you are all doing well. I am a teacher and teach students about IT. But from my job, I cannot fulfil my expenses that why start learning about Bitcoin the last 3 months my friend told me about the Bitcointalk forum in start working on bounties but not earned any money yet Now he said to make post other section will help me to trade and earning. I read the rules before posting. Can someone guide me on how I manage my time and earn money from trading what is an effective way to start?This condition reminds me of when I was still teaching and finally ventured into the crypto world to increase my income.Honestly, this will not be easy, or not as easy as other people might get when we initially see them seem successful and get a lot of earnings.But one thing is certain when we are willing to try and be willing to sacrifice a little time to learn more, it is possible that we will get better income or additional income from both forums and trading activities. 1. Regarding bounty participation, to be honest, this is true. The first time I was in this forum was just focusing on joining the bounty program without thinking about what contribution we should make, just making a few posts to meet the requirements. Listen, avoid this method, I've done it for a while at that time and it really didn't work, especially when our rank is still below Full member.It would be better if you would spend a few months of your time learning how to contribute to this forum, improve the quality of your posts, and work on increasing your ranks by earning merit. of course, you have to study more often and in more ways, observe if there is a help board on your local board. Indeed, this is like spending time, however, this really works, if you are serious and want to learn, then you will get various benefits when you can rise to higher ranks and take part in signature campaigns that pay BTC.It won't be easy, but that doesn't mean it can't be done.2. Related to trading activities for earning more money.Are you sure you want to do this? Trading is quite a risky activity, especially for beginners. There is no guarantee that you will get a bigger profit than the possible losses. However, if you are really ready for the risks, learn about crypto trading first, both the exchange to be used, how to analyze and strategy, and various complex things related to trading in the application, including how to choose a coin. Don't easily trust the trading signals on the telegam group, they might help but don't take it right away, study the market in that situation too. Maybe you will also find several online trading courses, if needed, you can follow them to increase your knowledge of trading methods and adjust them to your own abilities and analysis. It will be better if you try to start from Spot trading first, don't try to Future market at the beginning of your trading, this is very risky.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Just keep your job while you are still in the process of learning and accumulating knowledge and skills in trading. And for you to do that, explore the forum first and find topics that are related to trading and understanding them well. You can always do your due diligence to do the research as much as possible so you can add more knowledge aside from the posted topics here in the forum. Also, there are free youtube videos in the internet on how to trade, you start viewing on it. And when you’re ready to trade, put a small amount of money first since newbies are more susceptible to losses at first, and when you’ve gained a lot of experiences in trading, that’s the time you can start adjusting your trading size so you can also expect bigger returns too.
